hero.title: Make your product stand out.
hero.highlighted: A communication suite for modern digital products.
hero.subtitle:
Building is only half the journey.
Hikai helps product-lead teams turn progress into consistent market presence.

how.title: Turn progress into
how.subtitle: Hikai captures what's happening and delivers it to your audience in four clear steps.

step1.headline: Let Hikai understand your product
step1.body:
Connect your product sources — GitHub, Linear, Notion, and more — and define a clear baseline for what your product is. All in minutes.
From this context, Hikai automatically builds a deep, business-oriented understanding of your product: what’s being built, why it matters, and how everything fits together.

This product-centric foundation is set once and improves over time as your product evolves.
bullets: One baseline that evolves over time

feature.title: Product context & taxonomy
feature.description: Define what your product is and generate a structured, evolving taxonomy automatically.
links: Let Hikai build your product taxonomy

step2.headline: Your product, over time
step2.body:
Hikai automatically tracks every product event across your stack — features, fixes, improvements, and changes — on the cadence you choose.
Each event is interpreted, grouped, and placed into a living, shareable product timeline that reflects real progress over time.

No manual reporting. No status updates.
Just a continuously updated view of what’s happening in your product, translated into a timeline your audience can actually understand.

feature.title: Automated product timeline
feature.description: A living timeline that interprets product changes and adapts language to each audience.

step3.headline: The effortless way to communicate your product
step3.body:
From your product timeline, Hikai generates content proposals that follow a consistent editorial line.
Each update is automatically adapted for your market, users, and stakeholders — without starting from a blank page.

Instead of isolated efforts, you get a systematic, repeatable way to communicate what your product is doing and why it matters.

feature.title: Editorial content proposals
feature.description: Generate consistent, audience-specific content proposals from your product timeline.

step4.headline: Human control. Keep your voice.
step4.body:
Review, refine, and publish using purpose-oriented editing and publishing tools.
Hikai handles the heavy lifting, but you stay in control of tone, emphasis, and narrative.

The result feels human — because it is.
Your judgment defines the story your product tells to the world.

feature.title: Purpose-oriented editing & publishing
feature.description: Edit and publish with tools designed to preserve intent, voice, and clarity.

faq.title: Everything you need to
faq.subtitle: From security to use cases, here's what founders and teams ask most.

items.question: Is Hikai replacing my marketing team?
items.answer: Not at all. Marketing teams actually get more out of Hikai: less time chasing product updates, more time focusing on strategy and creativity.

items.question: When is the Beta launching?
items.answer: We're opening early access soon. Join the waitlist to be among the first founders to try it out.

items.question: What kind of content does Hikai create?
items.answer: From product updates to blog posts, user docs and social media. Everything comes directly from what's happening in your product.

items.question: Which teams can benefit from Hikai?
items.answer: Any team that needs to generate product-related content: marketing, customer success, even product and engineering. Hikai reduces the coordination overhead and makes updates effortless.

items.question: I'm a solo founder — is Hikai for me?
items.answer: Exactly. You are product, marketing, and customer success all at once. Hikai helps you cover those roles without the extra effort.

items.question: Is my product data safe with Hikai?
items.answer: Yes. Hikai only works with summaries of what's happening — never raw code or sensitive data. And you always have the final word before anything goes public.
